sentences.en: 4-1 was the final score.
sentences.cn: 最终比分是4比1。

sentences.en: a musical score
sentences.cn: 乐谱

sentences.en: a pacy winger who can also score goals
sentences.cn: 能射门得分的快速边锋

sentences.en: At half-time the score was one all.
sentences.cn: 半场时的比分是一比一。

sentences.en: Each event will be scored separately.
sentences.cn: 每个项目将单独评分。

sentences.en: Figo came infield from the left to score.
sentences.cn: 菲戈从左侧向场中心移动以求得分。

sentences.en: Great cheers went up when he scored in the final minute of the game.
sentences.cn: 当他在比赛的最后一分钟得分时，人群爆发出了雷鸣般的欢呼。

sentences.en: He was fated not to score.
sentences.cn: 他注定不会进球。

sentences.en: Iglesias scored twice to level the score.
sentences.cn: 伊格莱西亚斯连进两球，追平了比分。

sentences.en: Is anybody keeping score (= making a record of the score ) ?
sentences.cn: 有没有人负责记分？

sentences.en: Lightly score the surface of the steaks with a knife.
sentences.cn: 在牛排表面轻轻打花刀。

sentences.en: my priority was to blend new faces into the team and we have succeeded on that score.
sentences.cn: 我优先考虑的事是在队里融入一些新面孔，在这点上我们成功了。

sentences.en: power-driven hedge trimmers tend to get a bad press on the score of danger.
sentences.cn: 因为危险，电动修篱器可能不受欢迎。

sentences.en: Responses to the individual items are scored on a scale ranging from 0 to 12.
sentences.cn: 每道题的回答都按0到12的标准来打分。

sentences.en: She scored an average of 9.9 in the test.
sentences.cn: 这次考试她的平均分是9.9。

sentences.en: Tempers began to fray as the two teams failed to score.
sentences.cn: 随着两队都没能破门得分，大家渐渐沉不住气了。

sentences.en: The companies brought out new products by the score.
sentences.cn: 那些公司生产了大量的新产品。

sentences.en: The dance is accompanied by an original score by Henry Torgue.
sentences.cn: 这支舞蹈的配乐是由亨利·托尔格所作的一首原创曲目。

sentences.en: The final score was Southampton two, Leeds United nil.
sentences.cn: 最后的比分是二比零，南安普敦队击败利兹联队。

sentences.en: The school’s test scores have not improved.
sentences.cn: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

sentences.en: The score at full-time was Arsenal 1, Sampdoria 1.
sentences.cn: 比赛结束时阿森纳队和桑普多利亚队1比1战平。

sentences.en: The score at half-time was two all.
sentences.cn: 上半场比分为二平。

sentences.en: The score calls for a contralto.
sentences.cn: 这次的配乐需要一位女低音歌手。

sentences.en: The weakest students can end up with a negative score.
sentences.cn: 最差的学生可能会以负分收场。

sentences.en: They beat the Giants by a score of 7 to 3.
sentences.cn: 他们以7比3的比分击败了巨人队。

sentences.en: They're just trying to score brownie points with politicians.
sentences.cn: 他们只是试图获得政客们的嘉许。

sentences.en: What’s the score?
sentences.cn: 比分是多少？

sentences.en: Who wrote the score for the movie?
sentences.cn: 这部电影的配乐是谁谱写的？

words.tran_cn: （竞赛等的）记分员；记录员；得分者；刻划痕迹的人

phrases.tran_cn: 保留得分；在比赛中记分
(非正式)了解情况（指主要事实）
为（某队）进球/得分；为…得分；把…改写成器乐曲
(英，非正式)（尤指辩论中） 胜过；羞辱

phrases.phrase: settle (或 pay) a (或 the) score

phrases.tran_cn: 成绩；校验得分；测验分数

trans.tran_cn: 得分，分数，二十，总谱，配乐，大量，刻痕，实情
trans.tran_en: a written or printed copy of a piece of music, especially for a large group of performers, or the music itself
a written or printed copy of a piece of music, especially for a large group of performers, or the music itself
the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

trans.tran_cn: 得分，记分，获得胜利，编总谱，划下痕迹，非法购买
trans.tran_en: to win a point in a sport, game, competition, or test

trans.tran_cn: 分， 给…打分； 画线于； 获胜
trans.tran_en: to give a particular number of points in a game, competition, test, or  experiment
